name: Clin N Vulva
title: Clinical N
notes:
**Note 1:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis. 

**Note 2:** For regional lymph nodes, assign the appropriate N category based on the number of positive nodes.

    Deep inguinal, NOS
    Femoral
    Inguinal NOS 
    Inguinofemoral (groin) 
    Node of Cloquet or Rosenmuller (highest deep inguinal)
    Superficial inguinal (femoral) 

    Regional lymph node(s), NOS
    Lymph nodes, NOS 

**Note 3:**  Assign N1 [NOS] if regional lymph nodes are involved but the number of nodes involved is unknown.

**Note 4:** When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and regional lymph node detail are available, use the regional lymph node detail in preference to a statement of FIGO stage. See the Registrar Notes when FIGO stage is the only information available. If the only available information is FIGO IVA, assign N3 if based on positive nodes and NX if based on extension or unknown basis.
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Clinical evaluation but unknown results or regional lymph node involvement not stated
Clinical evaluation done but results not documented in patient record

Only information available is Stage IVA based on extension or unknown basis
Regional lymph node metastasis with the following features

Note: N1 has subcategories of N1a and N1b. Assign N1 only when there is no 
information available to assign one of the subcategories

1 or 2 regional lymph node(s) positive (or number positive unknown) and size of metastasis not given

FIGO Stage IIIA or III [NOS]

Stated as N1 [NOS]
1-2 lymph node metastasis each less than 5 mm
1 lymph node metastasis 5 mm or greater
Regional lymph node metastasis with the following features

Note: N2 has subcategories of N2a and N2b. Assign N2 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

3 or more regional lymph node(s) positive and size of metastases not given

FIGO Stage IIIB

Stated as N2 [NOS]
3 or more lymph node metastases each less than 5 mm

3 or more regional lymph nodes positive and size of metastasis in each node less than 5 mm

Stated as N2a
2 or more lymph node metastases 5 mm or greater

At least 2 lymph node metastases equal to or greater than 5 mm

Stated as N2b
Lymph node  metastases with extracapsular spread

Regional lymph node(s) with extracapsular spread

FIGO Stage IIIC

Stated as N2c
Fixed or ulcerated regional lymph node metastasis

Fixed or ulcerated regional lymph nodes

FIGO Stage IVA based on regional lymph node involvement

Stated as N3
Clinical N is not defined for the specific site/histology

No clinical evaluation of regional lymph nodes
Cancer first detected on surgical resection
Unknown if any clinical assessment performed
